(In reply to comment #0)
> Framework arguments:  -Xms192M -Xmx1G
> Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86_64 -Xms192M -Xmx1G

Seems like you're trying to increase the JVM heap size, but you forgot to prefix the -Xms and -Xmx options with -vmargs. Otherwise they would not
appear as arguments to Eclipse.

prepended -vmargs but the heap kept running full. changing the indexer to ctags solved the issue -- but i'm not sure what the full indexer causes to eat _all_ available memory. increasing the Xmx did not help, every available mb had been eaten.

ctags is the right answer for now, the full indexer has problems with some complex files leading to the out-of-memory condition. I am rewriting the indexer for CDT 3.1 which should hopefully help this.
